str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To speak freely, boldly; To be confident.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Necessary, essential, intimate, right, proper. From anagke; necessary; by implication, close.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.
Of time: when, now, after that; of cause: seeing that, forasmuch as. From epei and de; since now, i.e. when, or whereas.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Or apothomai ap-o'-thom-ahee from apo and the middle voice of otheo or otho; to push off, figuratively, to reject.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
From aion; perpetual.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
